importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the announcement of Doug Martin's passing, indicating the timeline of the public revelation of his death.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame from Martin's NFL draft in 2012 to his death in 2025 captures his professional football career and post-career life.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft after a standout college career at Boise State.
He accumulated 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns over seven seasons in the NFL, including a Pro Bowl selection in 2015.
Martin played for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers (six seasons) and the Las Vegas Raiders (one season).
He also had 148 catches for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
His family confirmed his passing, stating the cause of death is unconfirmed.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers acknowledged his significant impact on the franchise and named him one of the top 50 players in team history during their 50th anniversary celebration.
Doug Martin's death has sparked public mourning and recognition of his legacy in American football.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at age 36. Selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft after a standout college career at Boise State, Martin amassed 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns over seven NFL seasons, including Pro Bowl and first-team All-Pro honors in 2015. He also had 148 receptions for 1,207 yards. The Buccaneers honored him as one of their top 50 players during their 50th-anniversary celebration. His family confirmed his passing, though the cause remains unconfirmed.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
